data.title: Semantic Versioning
data.statement:
Given a <<version number>> and MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH, increment the:

MAJOR version when you make incompatible API changes,
MINOR version when you add functionality in a backwards compatible manner, and
PATCH version when you make backwards compatible bug fixes.

Example: 
a 2.0.0 version number with {{MAJOR}} changes should result in a 3.0.0
a 2.0.0 version number with {{MINOR}} changes should result in a 2.1.0
a 2.0.0 version number with {{PATCH}} changes should result in a 2.0.1
data.constraints:
[[v]] is a string
[[i]] is only MAJOR, MINOR or PATCH
data.stubGenerator:
read v:string(12)
read i:string(5)

write version
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A string [[v]] for the current version 
<<Line 2:>> An increment [[i]] for the change to apply

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a version number and MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH, increment the:

MAJOR version when you make incompatible API changes,
MINOR version when you add functionality in a backwards compatible manner, and
PATCH version when you make backwards compatible bug fixes.

Example:
a 2.0.0 version number with MAJOR changes should result in a 3.0.0
a 2.0.0 version number with MINOR changes should result in a 2.1.0
a 2.0.0 version number with PATCH changes should result in a 2.0.1
Input
Line 1: A string v for the current version
Line 2: An increment i for the change to apply
Output
Line 1 : the new version number
Constraints
v is a string
i is only MAJOR, MINOR or PATCH
Example
Input
0.0.0
MAJOR
Output
1.0.0
